meanings.sent1: The cat will elve through the bushes to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent2: The spy decided to elve past the guards unnoticed.
meanings.sent3: The ninja's ability to elve around the room amazed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The shadows seemed to elve along the walls as the night deepened.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves elve across the ground in a silent dance.

meanings.definition: A supernatural being in folklore, similar to an elf
meanings.sent1: In the story, the elve helped the lost children find their way home.
meanings.sent2: The elve was said to have magical powers and a mischievous nature.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elve played pranks on the villagers every night.
meanings.sent4: The elve's laughter echoed through the forest, enchanting all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: Legend has it that the elve would grant wishes to those who showed kindness.

meanings.definition: To dig or delve into something
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist will elve into the ancient ruins to uncover hidden treasures.
meanings.sent2: She decided to elve into the mystery of the missing necklace.
meanings.sent3: The curious child wanted to elve into the box of old toys.
meanings.sent4: Her mind began to elve into the possibilities of what the future might hold.
meanings.sent5: The detective's instincts told him to elve deeper into the case for the truth.
